capacity0.string: You have<x id='START_SPAN'/>0<x id='END_SPAN'/> blocks left.
capacity0.description: warning - No more blocks may be added until some are removed.  Do not alter the portions between pointy brackets (< and >), although you may move them within the phrase and replace 0 with one or more words.

capacity1.string: You have <x id='START_SPAN'/>1<x id='END_SPAN'/> block left.
capacity1.description: warning - Only one more block may be added.  Do not alter the portions between pointy brackets (< and >), although you may move them within the phrase and replace 1 with one or more words.

capacity2.description: warning - Only %1 more blocks may be used, where %1 is an integer greater than 1.  Do not alter the portions between pointy brackets (< and >), although you may move them within the phrase.

codeTooltip.description: tooltip (pop-up help) for button; pressing the button causes a program in the JavaScript computer language to be displayed, based on the program created by the user.

continue.description: button - Closes the dialog and continues to the next level

dirE.description: An abbreviation of the direction East

dirN.description: An abbreviation of the direction North

dirS.description: An abbreviation of the direction North

dirW.description: An abbreviation of the direction West

doCode.description: verb - imperative or infinitive preceding one or more commands to a person.

elseCode.description: conjunction - 'otherwise', introducing commands to be performed if a previous condition was not true, as in 'if x>3, do this, else do that'.

finalLevel.string: Congratulations! You have solved the final level.
finalLevel.description: alert - This is displayed when the user solves the most difficult level.

ifTooltip.string: If there is a path in the specified direction, then do some actions.
ifTooltip.description: tooltip (pop-up help) - 'path' refers to a path through a maze.

ifelseTooltip.string: If there is a path in the specified direction, then do the first block of actions. Otherwise, do the second block of actions.
ifelseTooltip.description: tooltip (pop-up help) - 'path' refers to a path through a maze.

instructions1_10.string: Use the 'if-else' block to help me get out of the maze!
instructions1_10.description: instructions - an example of an 'if-else' block is: 'if there is a path to the left, turn left, else or otherwise turn right'.

instructions2_10.string: Try to reach the end of this path using only three blocks.
instructions2_10.description: instructions - 'path' refers to a path through a maze, and 'block' refers to a child's building block.

instructions2_11.string: Reach the goal using only five blocks.
instructions2_11.description: instructions - the goal is reaching the end point in a maze; 'block' refers to a child's building block.

instructions2_12.string: Reach the goal using only five blocks.
instructions2_12.description: instructions - the goal is reaching the end point in a maze; 'block' refers to a child's building block.

instructions2_13.string: I will have to turn left when I cannot go straight. Use an 'if' block to see if their is a path in another direction.
instructions2_13.description: instructions - 'turn left' refers to rotating in place a quarter circle counter-clockwise. An example of an 'if' block is: 'if there is a path to the left, turn left'.

instructions2_14.string: I will have to turn right when I cannot go straight. Use an 'if' block to see if their is a path in another direction.
instructions2_14.description: instructions - 'turn left' refers to rotating in place a quarter circle counter-clockwise. An example of an 'if' block is: 'if there is a path to the left, turn left'.

instructions2_15.string: An 'if' condition will do something only if the condition is true.  Try turning right if there is a path to the right.
instructions2_15.description: instructions - an example of an 'if' block is: 'if there is a path to the left, turn left'.

instructions2_16.string: An 'if' condition will do something only if the condition is true.  Try turning right if there is a path to the right.
instructions2_16.description: instructions - an example of an 'if' block is: 'if there is a path to the left, turn left'.

instructions2_17.string: If-else blocks will do one thing or the other.
instructions2_17.description: instructions - 'block' refers to a child's building block.

instructions2_18.string: Use the 'if-else' block to help me get out of the maze!
instructions2_18.description: instructions - an example of an 'if-else' block is: 'if there is a path to the left, turn left, else or otherwise turn right'.

instructions1_1.string: A program is a sequence of statements. Stack a couple of 'move forward' blocks together to help me reach the goal.
instructions1_1.description: instructions - the word 'program' refers to a computer program, and the words for 'stack' and 'blocks' should be the same as for stacking children's blocks. Use the imperative verb form appropriate for speaking to a child, gender unspecified.  If no gender-neutral singular/familiar form exists but a gender-neutral plural/formal form exists, use that instead.

instructions2_1.string: A program is a sequence of statements. Stack a couple of 'move forward' blocks together to help me reach the goal.
instructions2_1.description: instructions - the word 'program' refers to a computer program, and the words for 'stack' and 'blocks' should be the same as for stacking children's blocks. Use the imperative verb form appropriate for speaking to a child, gender unspecified.  If no gender-neutral singular/familiar form exists but a gender-neutral plural/formal form exists, use that instead.

instructions1_2.string: What should I do to follow the path?
instructions1_2.description: instructions - 'steps' refers to instructions in a computer program; 'path' refers to the path through a maze. See previous description for tense.

instructions2_2.string: A program is a sequence of statements. Stack a couple of 'move forward' blocks together to help me reach the goal.
instructions2_2.description: instructions - the word 'program' refers to a computer program, and the words for 'stack' and 'blocks' should be the same as for stacking children's blocks. Use the imperative verb form appropriate for speaking to a child, gender unspecified.  If no gender-neutral singular/familiar form exists but a gender-neutral plural/formal form exists, use that instead.

instructions1_3.string: Computers have limited memory. Reach the end of this path using only two blocks.
instructions1_3.description: instructions - 'path' refers to a path through a maze, and 'block' refers to a child's building block.

instructions2_3.string: What should I do to follow the path?
instructions2_3.description: instructions - 'steps' refers to instructions in a computer program; 'path' refers to the path through a maze. See previous description for tense.

instructions1_4.string: Reach the goal using only five blocks.
instructions1_4.description: instructions - the goal is reaching the end point in a maze; 'block' refers to a child's building block.

instructions2_4.string: What should I do to follow the path?
instructions2_4.description: instructions - 'steps' refers to instructions in a computer program; 'path' refers to the path through a maze. See previous description for tense.

instructions1_5.string: I will have to turn left when I cannot go straight. Use an 'if' block to see if their is a path in another direction.
instructions1_5.description: instructions - 'turn left' refers to rotating in place a quarter circle counter-clockwise. An example of an 'if' block is: 'if there is a path to the left, turn left'.

instructions2_5.string: Try to reach the end of this path using only two blocks.
instructions2_5.description: instructions - 'path' refers to a path through a maze, and 'block' refers to a child's building block.

instructions1_6.string: An 'if' condition will do something only if the condition is true.  Try turning left if there is a path to the left.
instructions1_6.description: instructions - an example of an 'if' block is: 'if there is a path to the left, turn left'.

instructions2_6.string: Try to reach the end of this path using only three blocks.
instructions2_6.description: instructions - 'path' refers to a path through a maze, and 'block' refers to a child's building block.

instructions1_7.string: A small change to the blocks from the previous maze will solve this level.
instructions1_7.description: instructions - 'blocks' refers to a child's building blocks

instructions2_7.string: Try to reach the end of this path using only two repeat blocks.
instructions2_7.description: instructions - 'path' refers to a path through a maze, and 'block' refers to a child's building block.

instructions1_8.string: You can use more than one 'if' statement.
instructions1_8.description: instructions - an example of an 'if' block is: 'if there is a path to the left, turn left'.

instructions2_8.string: Try to reach the end of this path using only two repeat blocks.
instructions2_8.description: instructions - 'path' refers to a path through a maze, and 'block' refers to a child's building block.

instructions1_9.string: If-else blocks will do one thing or the other.
instructions1_9.description: instructions - 'block' refers to a child's building block.

instructions2_9.string: Try to reach the end of this path using the new repeat block.
instructions2_9.description: instructions - 'path' refers to a path through a maze, and 'block' refers to a child's building block.

linkTooltip.description: tooltip (pop-up help) for button; pressing the button causes the user's program to be saved and for a URL to be provided for retrieving it.  The word 'blocks' is as in children's toy blocks.

maze.description: brief title - Specifies that this is Blockly's '''Maze''' tutorial.

moveForward.description: verb - imperative or infinitive for a person moving (walking) in the direction he/she is facing.

moveForwardTooltip.description: tooltip (pop-up help) - Pegman is the humanoid icon used in Google Maps. See picture at http://goo.gl/9I64i (http://maps.google.com/intl/en/help/maps/streetview/learn/pegman.html). The term 'space' refers to a single square within a maze.

nextLevel.string: Congratulations! You have completed this level.
nextLevel.description: alert - This is displayed when the user solves the maze, inviting them to precede to the next level of difficulty.

no.description: No indicates that this option is incorrect.

numBlocksNeeded.string: This level can be solved with %1 blocks.
numBlocksNeeded.description: alert - This is displayed when the user has used more blocks than is necessary.

oneTopBlock.string: On this level, you need to stack together all of the blocks in the white workspace.
oneTopBlock.description: alert - This is displayed if a user attempts to run a program composed of multiple stacks of blocks, letting them know they need to create a single stack.

pathAhead.description: condensed form of 'if there is a path ahead', as in: 'if path ahead, go forward'.

pathLeft.description: condensed form of 'if there is a path to the left', as in: 'if path to the left, turn left'.

pathRight.description: condensed form of 'if there is a path to the right', as in: 'if path to the right, turn right'.

q3right.description: Congratulating the user on correctly answering the question.

q3wrong.string: No - Try tracking my direction while following the program.
q3wrong.description: tracking is suggesting to the user that they should follow each instruction and follow how that will affect the movement. A 'program' is a set of instructions that tell the computer what to do next.

q5right.description: Congratulating the user on correctly answering the question.

q5wrong.string: No - Try tracking my direction while following the program.
q5wrong.description: Tracking is suggesting to the user that they should follow each instruction and follow how that will affect the movement. A 'program' is a set of instructions that tell the computer what to do next.

q9right.description: Congratulating the user on correctly answering the question.

q9wrong.string: No - Try tracking my direction while following the program.
q9wrong.description: tracking is suggesting to the user that they should follow each instruction and follow how that will affect the movement. A 'program' is a set of instructions that tell the computer what to do next.

reinfMsg1.string: Watch the video below and learn how to use blocks to make me move.
reinfMsg1.description: instructions - introduction to the Maze tutorial.

reinfMsg2.string: A repeat block repeats the blocks inside it until I reach the red marker.
reinfMsg2.description: instructions - 'block' refers to a child's stackable toys. A 'repeat' block is used to repeat blocks over and over. The red marker is the goal to be reached in the maze.

reinfMsg3.string: Which direction am I facing after this program ends?
reinfMsg3.description: instructions - program' refers to a series of instructions that tell the computer what to do next.

reinfMsg4.string: Here is an 'if' block: I will turn in a particular direction if there is a path in that direction. For example if there is a path to the left, I will turn left.
reinfMsg4.description: instructions - An example of an 'if' block is if there is a path to the left, turn left.

reinfMsg5.string: We can place 'if' blocks inside 'repeat' blocks. Where am I when this program ends? Click on the correct picture below.
reinfMsg5.description: instructions - An example of an 'if' block is if there is a path to the left, turn left. A 'repeat' block is used to repeat blocks over and over. 'program' refers to a series of instructions that tell the computer what to do next.

reinfMsg6.string: <x id='START_STRONG'/>Remember:<x id='END_STRONG'/><x id='START_UNORDERED_LIST'/><x id='START_ITEM'/>'repeat' blocks perform an action multiple times without additional blocks.<x id='END_ITEM'/><x id='START_ITEM'/>'if' blocks check if there is a path in a certain direction.<x id='END_ITEM'/><x id='END_UNORDERED_LIST'/>
reinfMsg6.description: instructions - A 'repeat' block is used to repeat blocks over and over.

reinfMsg8.string: Here is an 'if-else' block: I move forward if there is a path ahead, otherwise I turn left.
reinfMsg8.description: instructions - An example of an 'if-else' block is if there is a path ahead move forward, else turn left.

reinfMsg9.string: Will the blocks below move me to the red marker?
reinfMsg9.description: instructions - 'block' refers to a child's stackable toys. A 'repeat' block is used to repeat blocks over and over. The red marker is the goal to be reached in the maze.

repeatUntil.description: verb - imperative or infinitive to repeat the following commands.  The phrase is followed by the symbol denoting the end of the maze.

resetProgram.description: button label - Pressing the button causes Pegman return to the start of the maze (but does not delete the user's program.)

runProgram.description: button label - Pressing the button runs the computer program the user has written.

tryAgain.description: button - Closes the dialog and stays on the current level

turnLeft.description: verb - imperative or infinitive for a person turning his head and body one quarter rotation counter-clockwise.  Prefer a translation that has text in common with the translation of 'turn right'.  See [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus]].

turnRight.description: verb - imperative or infinitive for a person turning his head and body one quarter rotation clockwise. Prefer a translation that has text in common with the translation of 'turn left'.  See [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus]].

turnTooltip.string: Turns me left or right by 90 degrees.
turnTooltip.description: tooltip (pop-up help) - Pegman is the humanoid icon used in Google Maps. See picture at http://goo.gl/9I64i (http://maps.google.com/intl/en/help/maps/streetview/learn/pegman.html). The term 'space' refers to a single square within a maze.

whileTooltip.string: Repeat the enclosed actions until finish point is reached.
whileTooltip.description: tooltip (pop-up help) - Repeat the enclosed commands until the maze has been successfully completed (the end point reached).

yes.description: Yes indicates that this option is correct.
